entries.name: broadcast_list
entries.desc: The list of addresses where RingFinger will send query packets.

entries.name: multicast_hops
entries.desc: Maximum number of hops for sent multicast packets (if using a multicast address in the broadcast list).  The default is 1 (same as UDP broadcast).

entries.name: multicast_interface
entries.desc: The interface index to send IPv6 multicast packets from.

entries.name: port
entries.desc: The port that RingFinger will send query packets to.

entries.name: primary
entries.desc: Contain the first advertised TupleSpace after #lookup_ring_any is called.

entries.name: finger()
entries.desc: Creates a singleton RingFinger and looks for a RingServer.  Returns the created RingFinger.

entries.name: new(broadcast_list=@@broadcast_list, port=Ring_PORT)
entries.desc: Creates a new RingFinger that will look for RingServers at port on the addresses in broadcast_list.

entries.name: to_a()
entries.desc: Contains all discovered TupleSpaces except for the primary.

entries.name: each()
entries.desc: Iterates over all discovered TupleSpaces starting with the primary.

entries.name: lookup_ring(timeout=5, &block)
entries.desc: Looks up RingServers waiting timeout seconds.  RingServers will be given block as a callback, which will be called with the remote TupleSpace.

entries.name: lookup_ring_any(timeout=5)
entries.desc: Returns the first found remote TupleSpace.  Any further recovered TupleSpaces can be found by calling to_a.

entries.name: to_a()
entries.desc: Contains all discovered TupleSpaces except for the primary.
